code: @Manual{,   title = {rliesel: R Interface for the Liesel Probabilistic Programming Framework},   author = {Hannes Riebl and Paul Wiemann},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://liesel-devs.github.io/rliesel/}, }

what: R Interface for the Liesel Probabilistic Programming Framework
title: R Interface for the Liesel Probabilistic Programming Framework
text: goal RLiesel provide R interface probabilistic programming framework Liesel. RLiesel assists user expressing semi-parametric regression models probabilistic graphical models (PGMs). supports generalized additive models location, scale shape (GAMLSS) different response distributions, spline-based smooth terms shrinkage priors. second step, models can transferred Python analysis.

title: R Interface for the Liesel Probabilistic Programming Framework
text: can install development version RLiesel running following commands:

title: R Interface for the Liesel Probabilistic Programming Framework
text: liesel() function workhorse RLiesel can used set semi-parametric regression models. illustrate flexibility function means two examples.

title: R Interface for the Liesel Probabilistic Programming Framework
text: first example, assume linear relationship mean log-standard deviation response variable y explanatory variable x. regression predictors distributional parameters specified predictor() function. predictors passed predictors argument liesel() function named list. Finally, conditional distribution response variable needs defined via distribution argument: hierarchical structure Liesel model can visualized generic plot() function:  attributes Python model object nodes log-probability can accessed R $ operator, e.g. linear_mod$nodes$loc_p1_beta$value linear_mod$log_prob.
code: # generate some data set.seed(1337)  n <- 250 x <- runif(n) y <- rnorm(n, mean = x, sd = exp(x)) linear_mod <- liesel(   response = y,   distribution = "Normal",   predictors = list(     loc = predictor(~x, inverse_link = "Identity"),     scale = predictor(~x, inverse_link = "Exp")   ) ) plot(linear_mod)

title: R Interface for the Liesel Probabilistic Programming Framework
text: second example, location scale parameter connected explanatory variable x smoothing spline:  Users familiar mgcv package may recognize syntax gam() function, can used set equivalent model follows: Finally, Liesel model can saved pickle file save_model() command:
code: y <- rnorm(n, mean = sin(2 * pi * x), sd = exp(sin(2 * pi * x)))  spline_mod <- liesel(   response = y,   distribution = "Normal",   predictors = list(     loc = predictor(~s(x), inverse_link = "Identity"),     scale = predictor(~s(x), inverse_link = "Exp")   ) )  ## plot(spline_mod) library(mgcv) gam(list(y ~ s(x), ~s(x)), family = gaulss()) save_model(spline_mod, "spline-mod.pickle")

what: Check if the installed versions of RLiesel and Liesel are compatible — check_liesel_version
title: Check if the installed versions of RLiesel and Liesel are compatible — check_liesel_version
text: Note function needs called setting virtual conda environment, e.g. using reticulate::use_virtualenv() reticulate::use_condaenv().

title: Check if the installed versions of RLiesel and Liesel are compatible — check_liesel_version

what: Set up a Liesel distributional regression model — liesel
title: Set up a Liesel distributional regression model — liesel
text: Set probabilistic graphical model (PGM) representation distributional regression model (also known generalized additive model location, scale, shape (GAMLSS)) Liesel.

title: Set up a Liesel distributional regression model — liesel
code: liesel(   response,   distribution = "Normal",   predictors = list(     loc = predictor(~1, inverse_link = "Identity"),     scale = predictor(~1, inverse_link = "Exp")   ),   data = NULL,   knots = NULL,   diagonalize_penalties = TRUE,   builder = FALSE )

title: Set up a Liesel distributional regression model — liesel
text: response response vector (matrix). distribution string identifying TensorFlow distribution used response distribution. predictors list predictor() specifications. names list must match names parameters TensorFlow distribution. data data frame list containing data model. default, data extracted environment formulas. knots list containing knots per term. Passed mgcv::gam(). diagonalize_penalties Whether diagonalize smooth penalties. builder Whether return model builder model.

what: Load a Liesel model from a pickle file — load_model
title: Load a Liesel model from a pickle file — load_model
text: Load Liesel model pickle file

title: Load a Liesel model from a pickle file — load_model
Load a Liesel model from a pickle file — load_model
text: path file path load model .

what: Plot the graph of a Liesel model — plot.liesel.model.model.Model
title: Plot the graph of a Liesel model — plot.liesel.model.model.Model
text: Plot graph Liesel model

title: Plot the graph of a Liesel model — plot.liesel.model.model.Model
code: # S3 method for liesel.model.model.Model plot(x, nodes = FALSE, ...)

title: Plot the graph of a Liesel model — plot.liesel.model.model.Model
text: x model plot. nodes Whether plot computational nodes instead statistical variables. Defaults FALSE. ... Passed plot_vars() plot_nodes() function liesel.model.viz module.

what: Set up a Liesel regression predictor specification — predictor
title: Set up a Liesel regression predictor specification — predictor
text: Helper function set Liesel regression predictor specification.

title: Set up a Liesel regression predictor specification — predictor
Set up a Liesel regression predictor specification — predictor
text: formula one-sided formula. inverse_link string identifying TensorFlow bijector used inverse link. p_smooth_name name parametric smooth. NULL, name set automatically.

what: Use a Liesel virtual environment — use_liesel_venv
title: Use a Liesel virtual environment — use_liesel_venv
text: function defunct. Please configure Liesel virtual conda environment manually, e.g. using reticulate::use_virtualenv() reticulate::use_condaenv(). See vignette("versions", "reticulate").

title: Use a Liesel virtual environment — use_liesel_venv
code: use_liesel_venv(virtualenv = NULL, python = NULL, version = NULL)

title: Use a Liesel virtual environment — use_liesel_venv
text: virtualenv Either name , path , Python virtual environment. python path Python binary. version version Python use. reticulate search versions Python installed install_python() helper function.

what: Create and use a temporary Liesel virtual environment — use_tmp_liesel_venv
title: Create and use a temporary Liesel virtual environment — use_tmp_liesel_venv
text: Create temporary Python virtual environment, install Liesel , use reticulate.

title: Create and use a temporary Liesel virtual environment — use_tmp_liesel_venv
Create and use a temporary Liesel virtual environment — use_tmp_liesel_venv
text: ... Passed reticulate::virtualenv_create().
